title: Georgia Regional Transportation Authority
text:
The Georgia Regional Transportation Authority or GRTA (<a href="pronounce">pronounce</a>d like the <a href="name">name</a> "Greta") is a <a href="government%20agency">government agency</a> in the <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Georgia%20%28U.S.%20state%29">Georgia</a>. It was set up under former <a href="governor%20of%20Georgia">governor of Georgia</a> <a href="Roy%20Barnes">Roy Barnes</a>, in order to address mobility, air quality and land use and how they relate to the <a href="transport">transport</a>ation needs of <a href="metro%20Atlanta">metro Atlanta</a>, including both <a href="road">road</a>s and <a href="public%20transit">public transit</a>. It came about in large part because the numerous <a href="cities">cities</a> and <a href="County%20%28United%20States%29">counties</a> in the <a href="region">region</a> could not effectively (or would not at all) work with each other to achieve a comprehensive solution to the area's <a href="traffic">traffic</a> woes, and increasing summertime <a href="smog">smog</a> problems.
GRTA’s jurisdiction encompasses 13 Georgia counties in Metro Atlanta: <a href="Cherokee%20County%2C%20Georgia">Cherokee</a>, <a href="Clayton%20County%2C%20Georgia">Clayton</a>, <a href="Coweta%20County%2C%20Georgia">Coweta</a>, <a href="Cobb%20County%2C%20Georgia">Cobb</a>, <a href="DeKalb%20County%2C%20Georgia">DeKalb</a>, <a href="Douglas%20County%2C%20Georgia">Douglas</a>, <a href="Fayette%20County%2C%20Georgia">Fayette</a>, <a href="Forsyth%20County%2C%20Georgia">Forsyth</a>, <a href="Fulton%20County%2C%20Georgia">Fulton</a>, <a href="Gwinnett%20County%2C%20Georgia">Gwinnett</a>, <a href="Henry%20County%2C%20Georgia">Henry</a>, <a href="Paulding%20County%2C%20Georgia">Paulding</a>, and <a href="Rockdale%20County%2C%20Georgia">Rockdale</a>.
"Xpress" Regional Commuter Coach Service.
GRTA, in partnership with 12 metropolitan Atlanta counties, operates "Xpress", metropolitan Atlanta's first truly regional commuter <a href="transit%20bus">transit bus</a> system. As of February 25, 2013 33 "Xpress" routes are in operation. Unless noted, service is provided by a private operator under contract to GRTA "Xpress". Service hours are from roughly 5:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. weekdays with most service being rush hours only.
